intro: Myosotis baetica, commonly known as the Iberian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and oval-shaped, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the end of its stems. Myosotis baetica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
